author: Jen Murphy
title: An Olympic Daredevil’s Uphill Battle
text:
John Daly credits a first date with getting him to return to a sport where you hurl yourself head first down an icy chute on a tiny sled reaching speeds above 80 miles an hour.

Mr. Daly had made a clean split from the sport after a devastating 2014 Winter Olympics where he skidded from medal contention to 15th place on his final run of the men’s skeleton competition. “I decided to hang up my spandex and re-enter the real world,” he says.
